title: 104_s1512
content: The Act titled "Highway Rail Grade Crossing Safety Formula Enhancement Act of 1995" allocates funds for railway-highway crossings. The Act "Highway Rail Grade Crossing Safety Formula Enhancement Act of 1995" amends Section 104(b)(3) of title 23, United States Code to set aside 5 percent of funds for railway-highway crossings each fiscal year. The Act "Highway Rail Grade Crossing Safety Formula Enhancement Act of 1995" sets aside funds for railway-highway crossings based on accident ratios in States. 25 percent of funds for railway-highway crossings are apportioned based on the ratio of public crossings in each State to the total in all States. 25 percent of funds for railway-highway crossings are apportioned based on the ratio of public crossings in each State to the total in all States, with each State receiving a minimum apportionment of 1/4 of 1 percent of the funds. Puerto Rico and the District of Columbia receive 1/8 of 1 percent of funds allocated under clause (i). Section 133(d) of title 23, United States Code, is amended to allocate 10 percent of funds for safety programs for fiscal years 1991 through 1996. For fiscal year 1997, states must use a portion of allocated funds for sections 130 and 152. Funds under section 104(b)(3)(C) are only for section 130 in 1997. For fiscal year 1997, 5 percent of funds allocated to states under section 104(b)(3)(A) for the surface transportation program shall be used exclusively for section 152 to ensure adequate funding for sections 130 and 152. For fiscal year 1997, 5 percent of funds allocated to states under section 104(b)(3)(A) for the surface transportation program shall be used exclusively for section 152 to ensure adequate funding for sections 130 and 152. Technical corrections are made to section 130 of title 23, United States Code.
